metadata.name: RDP Connection Allowed Via Netsh.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects usage of the netsh command to open and allow connections to port 3389 (RDP). As seen used by Sarwent Malware

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\netsh.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('netsh.exe') AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('firewall ')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('add ')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('tcp ')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('3389')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('portopening')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('allow'))))

output.summary: Detects usage of the netsh command to open and allow connections to port 3389 (RDP). As seen used by Sarwent Malware

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate administration activity Reference: https://labs.sentinelone.com/sarwent-malware-updates-command-detonation/
